"Employer"), located in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania and Jeffrey Hanuscin, (hereinafter referred to as the "Employee"), residing at 2406 Sanibel Circle,

perturbation.changed_text:
THIS AGREEMENT is made and entered into this 1st day of June, 2017 by and between Prudential Bank (hereinafter referred to as the
"Company"), located in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania and Jeffrey Hanuscin, (hereinafter referred to as the "Employee"), residing at 2406 Sanibel Circle,
Palmyra, NJ 08065.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Employer' to 'Company' in the opening paragraph, while keeping 'Employer' in later sections, creates ambiguity as to which entity is bound by the obligations outlined in the contract. It is not defined if the 'Company' and 'Employer' are to be considered the same entity. This raises concerns about whether Prudential Bank or another entity is responsible for managing and overseeing the agreement.

perturbation.original_text:
ARTICLE VII
"Plan Management"
For purposes of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, the Employer will be the "Named Fiduciary" and Plan Administrator of the
split-dollar life insurance plan for which this Agreement is hereby designated the written plan instrument. The Employer's board of directors may
authorize a person or group of persons to fulfill the responsibilities of the Employer as Plan Administrator. The Named Fiduciary or the Plan
Administrator may employ others to render advice with regard to its responsibilities under this Plan. The Named Fiduciary may also allocate
fiduciary responsibilities to others and may exercise any other powers necessary for the discharge of its duties to the extent not in conflict with the
Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974.
perturbation.changed_text:
ARTICLE VII
"Plan Management"
For purposes of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, the Prudential Bank will be the "Named Fiduciary" and Plan Administrator of the
split-dollar life insurance plan for which this Agreement is hereby designated the written plan instrument. The Employer's board of directors may
authorize a person or group of persons to fulfill the responsibilities of the Bank as Plan Administrator. The Named Fiduciary or the Plan
Administrator may employ others to render advice with regard to its responsibilities under this Plan. The Named Fiduciary may also allocate
fiduciary responsibilities to others and may exercise any other powers necessary for the discharge of its duties to the extent not in conflict with the
Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974.
perturbation.explanation: Referencing 'Employer's board of directors' while replacing 'Employer' with 'Prudential Bank' as the Named Fiduciary and Plan Administrator creates confusion. The term 'Bank' is used within this article, but there is reference to the 'Employer's board of directors', suggesting a disconnect between entity and plan. It is unclear whether the Employer's board of directors has authority over the Prudential Bank, leading to uncertainty regarding who is responsible for the plan's administration.
